com.att.research.xacml.std

Class StdMutableAttribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.std.StdMutableAttribute
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Attribute
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JaxpAttribute

    public class StdMutableAttribute
extends java.lang.Object
implements Attribute
    Mutable implementation of the com.att.research.xacml.Attribute interface.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with an empty list of com.att.research.xacom.api.AttributeValues.

      StdMutableAttribute(Identifier categoryIdIn, Identifier attributeIdIn, AttributeValue<?> valueIn)
      Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with the given com.att.research.xacml.Identifiers for the XACML 3.0 Category and AttributeId properties and the given com.att.research.xacml.AttributeValue as its only value.
      StdMutableAttribute(Identifier categoryIdIn, Identifier attributeIdIn, AttributeValue<?> valueIn, java.lang.String issuerIn, boolean includeInResultsIn)
      Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with the given com.att.research.xacml.Identifiers for the XACML 3.0 Category and AttributeId properties, and the given com.att.research.xacml.AttributeValue as its only value.
      StdMutableAttribute(Identifier categoryIdIn, Identifier attributeIdIn, java.util.Collection<AttributeValue<?>> valuesIn, java.lang.String issuerIn, boolean includeInResultsIn)
      Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with the given com.att.research.xacml.Identifiers for the XACML 3.0 Category and AttributeId properties, and the given Collection of com.att.research.xacml.AttributeValues.

      Methods

      void addValue(AttributeValue<?> attributeValue)

      static StdMutableAttribute copy(Attribute attribute)
      Creates a new StdMutableAttribute that is a copy of the given Attribute.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      The implementation of the Attribute interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Attributes (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getAttributeId().equals(a2.getAttributeId()) AND a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND a1.getIssuer().equals(a2.getIssuer()) or both issuers are null AND a1.getIncludeInResults() == a2.getIncludeInResults AND a1.getValues() is pair-wise equal to a2.getValues()
      <T> java.util.Iterator<AttributeValue<T>> findValues(DataType<T> dataType)
      Finds all of the AttributeValue objects with the given DataType in the AttributeValues for this Attribute.

      Gets the Identifier for this Attribute object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StdMutableAttribute

        public StdMutableAttribute()
        Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with an empty list of com.att.research.xacom.api.AttributeValues.

      • StdMutableAttribute

        public StdMutableAttribute(Identifier categoryIdIn,
                   Identifier attributeIdIn,
                   java.util.Collection<AttributeValue<?>> valuesIn,
                   java.lang.String issuerIn,
                   boolean includeInResultsIn)
        Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with the given com.att.research.xacml.Identifiers for the XACML 3.0 Category and AttributeId properties, and the given Collection of com.att.research.xacml.AttributeValues. The String issuer may be null.
        Parameters:
        categoryIdIn - the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 Category of the new StdMutableAttribute
        attributeIdIn - the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 AttributeId of the new StdMutableAttribute
        valuesIn - the Collection of AttributeValues for the new StdMutableAttribute
        issuerIn - the String issuer of the new StdMutableAttribute
        includeInResultsIn - the boolean indicating whether this StdMutableAttribute should be in included in the XACML Response to a Request.

      • StdMutableAttribute

        public StdMutableAttribute(Attribute attributeCopy)

      • StdMutableAttribute

        public StdMutableAttribute(Identifier categoryIdIn,
                   Identifier attributeIdIn,
                   AttributeValue<?> valueIn,
                   java.lang.String issuerIn,
                   boolean includeInResultsIn)
        Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with the given com.att.research.xacml.Identifiers for the XACML 3.0 Category and AttributeId properties, and the given com.att.research.xacml.AttributeValue as its only value. The String issuer may be null.
        Parameters:
        categoryIdIn - the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 Category of the new StdMutableAttribute
        attributeIdIn - the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 AttributeId of the new StdMutableAttribute
        valueIn - the AttributeValue for the new StdMutableAttribute
        issuerIn - the String issuer of the new StdMutableAttribute
        includeInResultsIn - the boolean indicating whether this StdMutableAttribute should be in included in the XACML Response to a Request.

      • StdMutableAttribute

        public StdMutableAttribute(Identifier categoryIdIn,
                   Identifier attributeIdIn,
                   AttributeValue<?> valueIn)
        Creates a new StdMutableAttribute with the given com.att.research.xacml.Identifiers for the XACML 3.0 Category and AttributeId properties and the given com.att.research.xacml.AttributeValue as its only value. The issuer is null and the StdMutableAttribute will not be included in XACML 3.0 responses.
        Parameters:
        categoryIdIn - the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 Category of the new StdMutableAttribute
        attributeIdIn - the Identifier for the XACML 3.0 AttributeId of the new StdMutableAttribute
        valueIn - the AttributeValue for the new StdMutableAttribute

      • getValues

        public java.util.Collection<AttributeValue<?>> getValues()
        Description copied from interface: Attribute
        Gets the Collection of AttributeValue objects for this Attribute. If there are no AttributeValues in this Attribute, an empty Collection must be returned. The returned Collection should not be modified. Implementations are free to return an immutable view to enforce this.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface Attribute
        Returns:
        a Collection of the AttributeValues for this Attribute

      • findValues

        public <T> java.util.Iterator<AttributeValue<T>> findValues(DataType<T> dataType)
        Description copied from interface: Attribute
        Finds all of the AttributeValue objects with the given DataType in the AttributeValues for this Attribute. If there are no matching AttributeValues, an empty Iterator must be returned.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public boolean getIncludeInResults()
        Description copied from interface: Attribute

        Specified by:
        getIncludeInResults in interface Attribute
        Returns:

      • setIncludeInResults

        public void setIncludeInResults(boolean b)
        Sets the boolean flag indicating whether the XACML Attribute represented by this StdMutableAttribute should be included in the XACML Result from a decision including this StdMutableAttribute.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, this StdMutableAttribute should be included, otherwise not.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: Attribute
        The implementation of the Attribute interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Attributes (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getAttributeId().equals(a2.getAttributeId()) AND a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND a1.getIssuer().equals(a2.getIssuer()) or both issuers are null AND a1.getIncludeInResults() == a2.getIncludeInResults AND a1.getValues() is pair-wise equal to a2.getValues()
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Attribute
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
